intro: Ferulago leptocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferulago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Ferulago leptocarpa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
